result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kali L Danforth

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:40 PM Defendant Kali L Danforth in court.  Attorney Aaron Schenk in court for Kali L Danforth.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at. Atty Schenk indicates offer received, close to resolution, requests a status.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:45 PM  Defendant Kali L Danforth in court.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Aaron Schenk in court for Kali L Danforth.  Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Schenk indicates they've received an offer from the State, advises defendant needs some time to review that offer before proceeding.  State has no objection to adjournment.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Sheriff's Office - Auto/Adult WI Ferry costs ($42)
Status conference on July 14, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Court lifts Pre-Trial Release Monitoring Program requirement.   All other conditions remain in place as previously set.

Atty Schenk requests removal of SCRAM bracelet, makes statement.  State opposes request, makes statement.  Court questions victim on request.  Court makes statement, grants request to remove the SCRAM bracelet.  All other conditions remain in effect as previously set.

3:45 PM  Defendant Kali L Danforth in court.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Aaron Schenk appeared by video for Kali L Danforth.  Court reviews events in file.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea.  Court finds probable cause for bindover. Atty Schenk requests a status.
Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 19, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Schenk Adjournment Request to Judge Ehlers.            Pamela: Reschedule. DTE

Adjustment Number: 22A 005065,
Payable Number: 100422,
Receipt Number: 22R 002274,
Amount: $20.00
Adjourned initial appearance on April 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: Alcohol Monitoring - Medium Level. Alcohol monitor is to be installed by 4:30 pm on Friday, 4/08/22.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.   No violent contact with K.J.D.

1:03 PM Defendant Kali L Danforth in court.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.  Defendant indicates she doesn't qualify for SPD representation.  Defendant explains options to defendant regarding legal representation. Defendant indicates she'd like to petition for court appointed counsel. Court encourages defendant to fill out petition and file it the the Clerk of Courts office prior to next hearing.  Court questions defendant on address/employment.  Bond set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.
